d1069e29-a20b-4949-ba86-c2a47150a21c.description: This is a comprehensive deep dive into leading Connected Strategic organizations, where impact is measured in terms of human outcomes, and people matter. Participants who complete this course demonstrated competency setting Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) as a mechanism for communicating vision and clarifying expectations with their teams, and have also completed course work in supporting topics including conflict modes; goal alignment; individual goal setting; and coaching-based leadership.
d1069e29-a20b-4949-ba86-c2a47150a21c.name: Leading the Connected Strategic Organization

badge_template_activities.title: This course is open to people leaders and aspiring leaders at any career stage. The models we teach scale for applicability for leaders of individual contributors, up to senior leadership participants.

bae49dde-97a9-4f9a-b6b5-853f11f13ee3.description: Participants complete a total of 10.5 hours of coursework to achieve the following learning objectives: (1) Knowledge about why and when OKRs are helpful; (2) An understanding of the words and meanings of Evolutionary OKRs; (3) A working knowledge of how to coach Evolutionary OKRs, and (4) Red Currant Collective's entire library of OKR coaching tools, resources, cheat sheets and best practices to make it easier for coaches to successfully help others create excellent Objectives and Key Results.
bae49dde-97a9-4f9a-b6b5-853f11f13ee3.name: Coaching Evolutionary OKRs™

alignments.name: Participation criteria
alignments.description: Participants are expected to: (1) Attend the first two days of class and may opt in to day 3 exercises and final Q&A; (2) demonstrate competency with active listening and coaching practices (and an ability to step out of solutioning mode); (3) demonstrate that they have learned the difference between activities and Key Results.

badge_template_activities.title: Register via the Red Currant Collective Kajabi website, and provide basic contact information. This course is designed for leaders, OKR program team members, chiefs-of-staff, and strategic operators at any level of the organization or stage of career, who wish to develop a deep understanding of the practical application of OKRs and build skill for creating useful, impactful OKRs.
